StoryLyne.question:
Did everything to make money.
Borrowed and never returned! Duped and escaped!
Lay in a coffin with cash in the cupboard but nobody in church!

He didn’t recognize her efforts, took for granted her care. Over time came the distance. And before he knew it she had fled.

Love is lost in small, small ways.

And she thought short cuts would take her through. Hard work was an allergy. Managing schedules was difficult.

Miracle. She did get by!

Lethargic. Lazy. Slothful. You would think they would come in the way of success.

Success to him meant doing nothing!

Wanting to fit, she hung out with the 'cool' crowd. The 'with it' people.

True friends need not be cool!

Asking for favors didn't make him feel small. It's all about the money honey!

Friends are to be used!

He believed that if he did a few rituals luck would back him.

He forgot. God helps those who help themselves!

When ruthlessness becomes a way of life it is hard to be compassionate.

Sensitivity requires sensibilities.

An apple. An orange. A banana. More than a fruit basket.

Wellness is nutrition of being and soul.

Wasn’t going to be invited to the party. Feared missing out.

Becoming submissive and groveling was his only way!

Flirted and teased. Made suggestive advances.

Wondered why people labeled her easy going!

Was stopped from what she wanted to do. Hated control!

Everything may not be the way you see it!

StryngOfThought.question: Today is the first day of a new job/class.
I am late for an important meeting because I am stuck in traffic.
I am on my way to a party.
There is too much work to do.
On the way to the airport to catch a flight.
When my partner is really angry with me
I have given a presentation / taken a test and have not done well on it.
That promotion should have been mine. I deserved it.
I want to spend the day with my friend. But h/she refused.
I lost the medal by a whisker.
My lover ditched me. I feel

definitions.Anger: It is the intense emotion that you feel when you think that someone has behaved in an unfair, cruel, or unacceptable way
definitions.Pity: If you pity someone, you feel very sorry for them
definitions.Disgust: It is a feeling of very strong dislike or disapproval
definitions.Surprise: Is the feeling that you have when something unexpected happens
definitions.Anxiety: A state of intense apprehension or worry often accompanied by physical symptoms such as shaking, intense feelings in the gut, etc, after a very distressing experience
definitions.Despair: The feeling that everything is wrong and that nothing will improve
definitions.Embarrassed: Having or showing awareness of one's own existence, actions, etc.; conscious of oneself
definitions.Sympathetic: If you are sympathetic to someone who is in a bad situation, you are kind to them and show that you understand their feelings
definitions.Furious: Someone who is furious is extremely angry
definitions.Relief: If you feel a sense of relief, you feel happy because something unpleasant has not happened or is no longer happening
definitions.Depressed: If you are depressed you feel that you cannot enjoy anything, because your situation is so difficult and unpleasant that it will never improve
definitions.Resentful: It is bitterness and anger that someone feels about something
definitions.Enraged: If you are enraged by something, it makes you extremely angry
definitions.Frustrated: Having feelings of dissatisfaction or lack of fulfillment leading one to feel angry
definitions.Sad: If you are sad, you feel unhappy, usually because something has happened that you do not like
definitions.Hurt: A feeling of hurt is a feeling that you have when you think that you have been treated badly or judged unfairly
definitions.Angry: The intense emotion that you feel when you think that someone has behaved in an unfair, cruel, or unacceptable way
definitions.Indifferent: Showing no care or concern; uninterested
definitions.Gloomy: It does not give you much hope of success or happiness
definitions.Confused: Feeling or exhibiting an inability to understand; bewildered; perplexed
definitions.Nervous: Very excitable or sensitive; highly strung
definitions.Intolerant: Not able or willing to tolerate or endure
definitions.Panicky: Panic is a very strong feeling of anxiety or fear, which makes you act without thinking carefully
definitions.Discontent: Discontent is the feeling that you have when you are not satisfied with your situation
definitions.Happy: Someone who is happy has feelings of pleasure, usually because something nice has happened or because they feel satisfied with their life
definitions.Content: If you are content, you are fairly happy or satisfied
definitions.Remorseful: If you are remorseful, you feel very guilty and sorry about something wrong that you have done.
definitions.Anxious: A state of intense apprehension or worry often accompanied by physical symptoms such as shaking, intense feelings in the gut, etc, after a very distressing experience
definitions.Exasperated: If you describe a person as exasperated, you mean that they are frustrated or angry because of something that is happening or something that another person is doing
definitions.Tense: If you are tense, you are anxious and nervous and cannot relax
definitions.Regretful: Regret is a feeling of sadness or disappointment, which is caused by something that has happened or something that you have done or not done.
definitions.Tickled: If a fact or a situation tickles you, it amuses you or gives you pleasure
definitions.Apprehensive: Anxious or fearful about the future; uneasy
definitions.Calm: Not disturbed, agitated, or excited; under control
definitions.Miserable: If you describe a place or situation as miserable, you mean that it makes you feel depressed.
definitions.Excited: If you are excited, you are so happy that you cannot relax, especially because you are thinkingabout something pleasant that is going to happen to you
definitions.Worried: Feeling uneasy about a situation or thing; anxious
definitions.Energetic: Having or showing much energy or force; vigorous
definitions.Bored: If you are bored, you feel tired and impatient because you have lost interest in something or because it is too difficult to do
definitions.Edgy: If someone is edgy, they are nervous and anxious, and seem likely to lose control of themselves
definitions.Hopeless: If you feel hopeless, you feel very unhappy because there seems to be no possibility of a better situation or success
definitions.Rage: Rage is strong anger that is difficult to control
definitions.Motivated: Inspired by a desire to achieve something
definitions.Self-Pity: Self-pity is a feeling of unhappiness that you have about yourself and your problems, especially when this is unnecessary or greatly exaggerated
definitions.Disgusted: It is a feeling of very strong dislike or disapproval
definitions.Desolate: If someone is desolate, they feel very depressed, alone, and without hope
